title: Who was Joe Pass' favorite guitarist? - Quora

response.answer_text: A tasty question, this. I don’t know who Joe Pass’ favorite guitarist was, but I do remember a little story about how his walking bass technique developed. I can’t remember if he was in high school or college, but the ensemble he was playing in had no bassist. Joe started working in walking bass lines with his chord changes, creating a unique style that is still recognizable today. I think I might have to go have a little listen now…

According to the Wiki, Joe was strongly influenced early on by Django Reinhardt. However… Over his long career and exposure to many different musicians… He likely changed his ideas about “favorites”. For instance, towards the end of his career, he had gone from playing primarily with a plectrum to playing primarily fingerstyle.
